lv.lumii.layoutengine

Class Diagram

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.lumii.layoutengine.Element
      • lv.lumii.layoutengine.AbstractContainer
        • lv.lumii.layoutengine.Container
          • lv.lumii.layoutengine.Box
            • lv.lumii.layoutengine.Diagram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connectible

    public class Diagram
extends Box
    This class defines the diagram element. A diagram stores a fully independent set of elements and has methods for manipulating and arranging these elements.

    • Nested Class Summary

        Creates a new diagram.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the bounding rectangle of the new diagram
        arrangeStyle - the style according to which to arrange the elements of the diagram
        constraintType - the type of the layout constraints for the diagram

      • Diagram

        public Diagram(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
               java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> objectMap)
        Loads a diagram from the given XML element representing one. Maps the objects of the resulting diagram in objectMap, from their IDs in the given XML.
        Parameters:
        element - an XML element representing a diagram.
        objectMap - a map from object IDs in the XML to the objects of this diagram.

      • arrange

        public void arrange()
        Lays out the diagram from scratch according to its current position without necessarily maintaining existing element positions.

      • startTransaction

        public void startTransaction()
        Starts a transaction of diagram operations. While a transaction is active, operations are not executed immediately, they are collected and executed on endTransaction(), if possible. Some operations may still be performed earlier, particularly if multiple operation types are mixed in a single transaction. Transactions achieve better performance than performing operations individually. Note that changes to the diagram's element hierarchy are still immediate, only changes to their position are delayed.

      • endTransaction

        public void endTransaction()
        Performs all the work needed to effect all accumulated position changes since startTransaction(), then ends the current transaction.

      • startManual

        public void startManual()
        Sets the diagram to manual mode, where only line connections and rectangle nesting are maintained.

      • endManual

        public void endManual()
        Ends manual mode, fixing the diagram if necessary.

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Description copied from class: Element
        Removes the element and its descendant elements. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Overrides:
        remove in class Box

      • saveToXML

        public org.w3c.dom.Element saveToXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                     java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Integer> idMap)
        Saves this diagram to an XML element in the given document. Maps the objects of this diagram in idMap, using idMap.size() as the ID for each new element.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document in which to create the element
        idMap - a map from the objects of this diagram to their IDs in the resulting XML.
        Returns:
        an XML element corresponding to this diagram
